FrontEnd

Class LECanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • FrontEnd.LECanvas

  • public class LECanvas
extends java.lang.Object
    LECanvas class is used to interact with the canvas(also reffered as render) on the Level Editor view. The LECanvas enables to draw the board when required to display the editted level to the user. Methods various methods available such as loading the board into the canvas, resizing the board and etc.

        locX - location X of where to draw.
        locY - location Y of where to draw.
        carColour - specified colour of the car to draw.

        public java.lang.String placeOnSlot(double mouseX,
                                    double mouseY,
                                    java.lang.String tempSel,

                                    javafx.scene.control.Slider sliHeight,
                                    boolean tileSelected,
                                    int intPlayerSel,
                                    int rotate,
                                    LEMainController theController)
        Method to set a tile on a clicked location
        Parameters:
        mouseX - x coordinate of the mouse location
        mouseY - y coordinate of the mouse location
        tempSel - the tile value to be set
        sliWidth - slider for width
        sliHeight - slider for height
        tileSelected - boolean to see if a tile is selected to place
        intPlayerSel -
        rotate - value of the rotation of the tile

                         int locY,

        Parameters:
        tempSel - tile value to be drawn
        locX - location x of the tile to be drawn on the board
        locY - location y of the tile to be drawn on the board
        rotate - rotation value of the tile

      • setPlayerCoords

        public void setPlayerCoords()
        Setting the player coordinates for stuff that I've added It becomes a lot easier to refer to when it's just stored as a number and you don't have to loop through potentially 81 tiles every time to get it

      • setPlayerColours

        public void setPlayerColours(CarColours P1C,
                             CarColours P2C,
                             CarColours P3C,
                             CarColours P4C)
        Small method that sets the colour value currently being used, there can be a discrepancy between what LEMainController and LECanvas on what the colour is so this is here to rectify that
        Parameters:
        P1C - Player 1's Colour
        P2C - Player 2's Colour
        P3C - Player 3's Colour
        P4C - Player 4's Colour

      • highlighterMethod

        public void highlighterMethod(double mouseX,
                              double mouseY,
                              javafx.scene.control.Slider sliderW,
                              javafx.scene.control.Slider sliderH,
                              java.lang.String tileType,
                              int rotate,
                              java.lang.Boolean playerSel,
                              LEMainController theController)
        This method highlights players or tiles when you hover over them in the level editor
        Parameters:
        mouseX - X position of mouse relative to screen
        mouseY - Y position of mouse relative to screen
        sliderW - Width slider from LEMainController
        sliderH - Height slider from LEMainController
        tileType - The type of tile you will be highlighting
        rotate - The rotation at which the tile you're highlighting is at
        playerSel - If a player is selected, we ignore the code that highlights the player and default back to the tile to signify placement
        theController - LEMainController

      • drawAThing

        public void drawAThing(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                       int rotate,
                       double whereXDrawn,
                       double whereYDrawn,
                       javafx.scene.image.Image imgToDraw)
        This method draws a tile (Mostly used in highlighter method because it has to repeat so much)
        Parameters:
        gc - GraphicsContext from the Canvas object
        rotate - The rotation at which you'd like to display your image
        whereXDrawn - X coordinate of drawing relative to screen
        whereYDrawn - Y coordinate of drawing relative to screen
        imgToDraw - The image you wish to draw

      • highlighterReset

        public void highlighterReset()
        Small method to reset all the "prev" values for the highlighter when a board is redrawn (E.G for a resize) Helps stop phantom tiles appearing

      • checkForPlayerDraw

        public void checkForPlayerDraw(PlaceCoords placeCoordsTemp)
        This method checks if a player is on the tile that is being drawn at the moment and draws the player on top if so
        Parameters:
        placeCoordsTemp - The coordinates of the tile being drawn

      • checkForPlayerInt

        public int checkForPlayerInt(PlaceCoords placeCoords)
        This method checks for a player and returns the int of the player if it finds one (Defaults to -10
        Parameters:
        placeCoords - The coordinates to check
        Returns:
        The player that is on the tile

      • rotateHoveredTile

        public void rotateHoveredTile(double mouseX,
                              double mouseY,
                              javafx.scene.control.Slider sliderW,
                              javafx.scene.control.Slider sliderH,
                              LEMainController theController,
                              java.lang.Boolean playerSel,
                              java.lang.Boolean boolRightClick)
        This method handles rotating a tile when nothing is selected Also picking up a player if they are on the tile you click
        Parameters:
        mouseX - X position of mouse relative to screen
        mouseY - Y position of mouse relative to screen
        sliderW - Width slider from LEMainController
        sliderH - Height slider from LEMainController
        theController - LEMainController itself (Used for player selection)
        playerSel - Is a player selected currently?
        boolRightClick - Is the person right clicking (Rotates the tile below a player)
